noun.name: tie
noun.discription: a piece of clothing worn around the neck

object1.name: scarf
object1.discription: in parallel with 'tie', is a piece of fabric worn around the neck or head for warmth, fashion, or religious reasons

object2.name: belt
object2.discription: in parallel with 'tie', is a flexible band or strap, typically made of leather or heavy cloth, and worn around the waist to hold up clothing

object3.name: bracelet
object3.discription: in parallel with 'tie', is an ornament, often made of metal, leather, or beads, worn around the wrist

object4.name: necklace
object4.discription: in parallel with 'tie', is an article of jewellery that is worn around the neck, often made of precious metals and stones

object5.name: cravat
object5.discription: in parallel with 'tie', is a decorative cloth worn around the neck, especially an older style of necktie

object6.name: bow
object6.discription: in parallel with 'tie', is a decorative knot tied with a ribbon or string, often used in gift wrapping or hair accessories

object7.name: collar
object7.discription: in parallel with 'tie', is the part of a shirt or blouse that fastens around or frames the neck, typically made of a separate piece of fabric

object8.name: choker
object8.discription: in parallel with 'tie', is a close-fitting necklace, often made of beads, lace, or leather, worn high on the neck
